you
you
[Music]
hi and welcome you listening to the x22
report my name is Dave and this is
episode 1297 a and today's date is June
4th 2017 and the thought of the episode
is when central bankers tell you there's
no need to panic it's time to take
action now before I get started I just
want to make an announcement I uploaded
an interview with Bill halter on the
x-22 report spotlight YouTube channel so
all you need to do is go over to YouTube
type in X 20 report spotlight it will
bring you right to the video or you can
come over to the X 20 to report comp
site scroll down a little bit look over
the right-hand side you will see the
video there and you can play it right on
the site or you can go to News Sentinel
com same thing scroll down a little bit
look over the right-hand side you'll see
the video there and you can play it
right on the site let's get into the
economic collapse financial news now
we've been tracking the economy looking
at many of the economic sectors and
we've been looking at many of the
economic indicators and a lot of them
are flashing recession some are already
so bad that we're flashing a depression
and one indicator which is unemployment
well we're seeing something very
interesting historically unemployment
rate lows occurred at or very near to
market inflection points preceding a
recession now the unemployment rate just
re just released on June 2nd was at 4.2
9% it is now just below the average
unemployment entry prior two recessions
over the last 67 years at four point
four percent so if we look back in time
and we go to those years of 2007-2008 we
go to the years 2000 going into 2001 and
we go back in time to the 1990s we go
back in 2008 es we go back into the time
into 1970s the 60s all the way back in
time what do we see each and every
single time we see each time
we reach this point in unemployment
where it is at its lowest point we enter
either a recession a great recession or
depression and we are here today at that
point and it tells us and it's signaling
to us that we're here we are here at the
point of when we're going to enter
recession now I think we're already in a
recession everything that I've been
looking at all the economic data is
telling us that we've been in a
recession and we're actually heading
into a depression into a collapse
scenario remember the government will
not tell you the central bank definitely
will not tell you that you're in a
recession you know when they tell you
you're in a recession or a depression
when you're already in it they go back
and say oh yeah by the way this started
about eight months ago for all those
people that are curious but we just
figured it out now we've been telling
you that we are here now we know a lot
of the numbers have been manipulated and
from Morningside Hill they've calculated
that a full 93 percent of the new jobs
reported since 2008 since the Great
Recession six point three million
out of the six point seven million and
forty percent of the jobs in 2016 alone
were added through the business birth
and death model now this is a highly
controversial model which is not
supported by the data all data on the
establishment birth and death point to
an ongoing decrease in entrepreneurship
but what they have done is they are
using this model saying that
entrepreneurship is growing over time so
here's some information on how they use
this model so over 90 percent of the
jobs created in the past decade we're
nothing more than statistical
adjustments in the BLS model now they
use the birth-death adjustment so in
order to account for the jobs created or
lost by new business formations or
bankruptcies each month the BLS
introduced the birth-death adjustment it
started during the Reagan and
ministration because Reagan was
complaining that the bureau was
undercounting the jobs that he created
so they adjusted this model saying okay
there's a lot more businesses that are
being created they're very small we
can't account for them and this is how
they use it now the birth-death model
used to have a terrible name it was the
bias adjustment factor so this
adjustment the way it is computed it
uses a model based on probability based
sampling methodology now according to
the BLS in the depths of the 2007-2009
recession the birth-death adjustment
continued to add a lot of jobs 904
thousand jobs were added in 2009 alone
now we need to think about what happened
in 2008-2009 because during the Great
Recession what we see happening a lot of
businesses are defaulting a lot of
businesses went out of business and that
continually skyrocketed throughout time
and the birth and death adjustment would
be a net negative and subtract from the
overall jobs number instead of adding to
it so it turns out the BLS they wanted
to include this adjustment because they
wanted to make it look like that jobs
were being created and basically they
use this even though businesses were
declining during that period because
again we have to go back to the original
thought process of this entire system
during the 80s small businesses were
being created left and right and Reagan
was afraid that they were not being
accounted for and you can see back in
that time the entire economy was growing
here businesses have been declining but
they were still using this model making
everyone think that businesses were
popping up in all different places so we
could see how they skewed the entire
unemployment numbers by using this model
so basic
what has happened is that during this
period of time using this statistical
calculation they're showing us that
these jobs really don't exist because
they're only there in statistics they're
not there in real life and that's why
ninety-three percent of the all jobs
were created using this method and if
you subtract out all of this the
unemployment is not four point two nine
percent because as we can see that
businesses per year continually declined
and they are still declining I mean
think about what you're seeing now and a
much larger scale I mean the small
businesses you really couldn't see
because the corporate media really
doesn't report on it you don't really
know how many small businesses there are
yes the government does because they
keep track of all this and they realize
that yes they're declining but they were
still using the old model because they
wanted to make us believe that things
were getting better this was part of
their plan now we see it on a much
larger scale we see retail stores well
they're closing all over the place a lot
of them are going bankrupt I mean look
at Gymboree just a couple days ago we
reported on how Gymboree if they don't
make their interest payments what were
they going to have to do they were going
to have to declare bankruptcy well guess
what they miss their interest payment so
guess what they're going to have to do
right now they have to declare
bankruptcy and this is not the only
business I mean we have many businesses
right now that are slated to declare
bankruptcy sometime during this year
this is how bad it is we're looking at
Nine West we're looking at true religion
jeans we're looking at charming Charlie
we're looking at Clare stores chinos and
many others Sears
many others that are going to declare
bankruptcy they're going to be closing a
lot of stores and again the death the
birth death model will not fit into this
because as these larger stores closed a
lot of the small businesses are closing
and they're not being created and the
whole thing is a complete illusion and
they've been
using this all alone out in San
Francisco what do we say well we know
that the housing bubble is starting to
deflate there we're also seeing
something very interesting hiring has
dropped by 4.1 percent in May
year-over-year and this is coming out of
the LinkedIn's workforce report so when
you compare this with the Employment
Development Department and their data
well it shows that the growth of both
the labor force and the employment in
San Francisco
it is fizzling right now and we could
see when we look at a graph of this the
job growth in San Francisco
year-over-year you can see that it has
been declining it has not been going the
opposite way where it's been increasing
it is declining right now and we're
hitting that point where we're almost
back to where we were prior to 2008 and
after 2008 where everything just come to
fell apart
now we're starting to see in many
different areas things rapidly fall
apart very very quickly we're seeing new
home sales they're declining we see
existing home sales declining pending
home sales declining
more and more stores they're going
bankrupt they're closing a lot of small
businesses are closing corporate
defaults on the rise corporate debt bomb
is here and we can see that most of
these bubbles well they're deflating or
they getting ready to pop now out in
Greenwich Connecticut we see something
very interesting this is the ultra
luxury estates priced over ten million
dollars and they collapsed after 2008
and things are not looking good right
now now there were only five sales for
ten million or more in 2015 and 2016
this is the slowest pace in this
category since 2008 now prior to 2008
they were selling like crazy all over
the place around 2010 leading up to
about 2014 again the bubbles were
increasing free money was out there the
central bank's a Fed they were pushing
the money into the stock market and
these homes took off
now we see the opposite happening where
things are starting to fizzle out and
die down once again coming from Houlihan
and Lawrence they're saying there's
roughly around 38 properties listed for
10 million in and around that area of
Greenwich and they're saying to sell
these type of properties it might take
it as long as seven years because right
now there's just nobody coming
whatsoever and traffic has dried up the
sales have dried up and they're all
trying to figure out what is going on
here now we've been following the real
estate market for quite a while we
understand what is going on and you can
see it throughout many many different
areas
now again Case Shiller has the 20 cities
where they've been blowing up bubbles
and yes that hit other areas in the
outlying areas but outside of the 20
cities you can see that real estate is
having a very difficult time and we need
to understand that this is the hot
season for real estate this is the
season that everyone waits for this is
when they put their houses up for sale
this is when the flowers are blooming
when the weather is warm everyone's in a
good mood you can go out and take a look
at the homes and we're seeing the
opposite happen and this is continually
happening every single year where the
summer months the spring months they
continually decline and this is going to
be one of the worst seasons for real
estate that we have seen in a very long
time now we understand that the central
bank since 2008 they'd had to purchase
up a huge amount of assets toxic assets
bonds stocks you name it they had to
purchase these things to keep the
economy's operational because without
them in their basements with their
trading desks buying up all these
different things the entire system would
have imploded in 2008 now this doesn't
mean they made it a lot better it means
they're the ones just holding all of
this they created trillions and
trillions of dollars out of thin air
listen they're not on the hook for this
the people are on the hook for this
they're just holding all the assets they
purchased all the assets they hold
trillions and
millions of dollars of real estate and
bonds and things like that actually if
you look at it 50 percent of this
universe is owned by banks central banks
or commercial banks central banks own a
third of the entire 54 trillion global
bond market now think about this they
want to unwind their balance sheets they
want to sell this now how are they going
to do this without crashing the bond
market it is completely impossible and
they know this they realize that they
will not be able to do this and what
we're seeing right now is that they're
stuck and the only way to get out of
this is to crash the system is to bring
it down now in their minds well we can
bring the system down we can make a lot
of cash on the way down we can buy up
more assets and we can push the blame to
someplace else this has been their plan
for a very long time on the other side
we have Trump using their tactics and
trying to blow up these bubbles and
trying to shift the narrative on the
central banks and what we're seeing is
that banks around the world we know
they're insolvent they're having a lot
of trouble the central bank continually
steps in tries to bail them out if they
can't bail them out they're going to use
bail ends and we can see Deutsche Bank
yes that's still in trouble the Italian
banks are still in trouble we talked
about Spain's Banco Popular that Bank is
in a huge amount of trouble and what's
very interesting about all of this is
that the bankers the central bankers
they're telling the employees the
individuals who have investment with the
bank don't panic everything is going to
be okay now every time a central bank or
bank tells you that everything is going
to be okay don't panic
this is when you need to take action
this is when you need to say you know
something I'm going to take my funds out
of the bank I'm going to invest it
someplace else I'm going to maybe take
it put it into crypto
we may better take it and put into
silver and gold but whatever I'm going
to do I'm going to remove it from the
bank now when this system comes down
you're not going to get this type of
warning but we've heard these type of
warnings before remember Ben Bernanke
we're not forecasting any type of
recession everything's contained the
subprime securities nothing to worry
about housing prices they never fall
they just keep going up when you hear a
central banker or a banker telling you
that everything's going to be fine don't
panic this is when you say okay you know
something let me just do something to
protect myself because I don't really
care what they have to say because
they've been wrong almost every single
time and every time they told us that
everything was going to be okay it
wasn't and we are entering that phase
once again you're going to hear that
everything is going to be fine
this bank is fine don't worry about it
that Bank is fine don't worry about it
the economy is doing fine yes the market
dropped by a thousand points but don't
worry everything is fine now if you
haven't started to prepare I would start
preparing now making sure that you can
protect yourself for when these things
happen you don't want to be that
individual back in 2008 maybe you were
that individual back in 2008 where all
of a sudden you lost your job you're
living in your house you can't pay your
bills you can't find another job and all
your wealth is completely gone because
you had to declare bankruptcy the bank
took your house you don't want to be
stuck in that situation you want to
protect yourself for when things go
south and basically in my personal
opinion is to get out of paper assets to
put it someplace where it basically
protects your wealth that is gold silver
some people are saying cryptocurrency I
would have a mix right now
at this point to make sure you're
covered in all different areas and just
to be clear about all this I can
understand if it was just one economic
indicator saying okay you know something
that's flashing or
and all the others are not but now we're
seeing the unemployment numbers
historically we've seen the same thing
happen time and time again we see
industrial production the same thing
we're seeing the credit impulse it is
now in the negative territory we see the
feds financial indicators also pointing
to a recession and this continues on and
on and on now the other indicators are
things that we see with our own eyes all
the stores are contracting many stores
are going bankrupt people are losing
their jobs small businesses have been
declining wages have been declining
interest rates well they can't really
raise them back to the normal rate most
of the world is either zero or negative
they're continuing with stimulus in the
background they just keep on shifting it
from country from bank to bank so what
we're seeing right now is all these
different economic indicators they're
all signaling the same thing now and we
can see with our own eyes the economy
contracting I'm not talking about the
stock market because that is completely
manipulated talking about everything
else is contracting and eventually what
will happen as it continually contracts
the whole thing just implodes on itself
and this is why you need to be ready and
prepared listen everyone thanks a lot
for listening be well be safe and
especially be prepared thanks a lot
[Music]
you
you
